channel.title: What would have happened if Mir-Hossein Mousavi had won the Iran election
channel.description: I am still putting together my views and theories on what would have happened if Mir-Hossein Mousavi had won the election. Discuss.

item.title: What would have happened if Mir-Hossein Mousavi had won the Iran election
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:3, topic:284111”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=375543.msg2829677#msg2829677 date=1245289803]
Considering it was rigged, it would never happen.
[/quote]
Did they find proof? Haven’t watched the news in a few days, but I wouldn’t really trust the American networks anyways.[/quote]
Iirc, they gave a result 30min after the polls closed.

Read full topic
item.source: What would have happened if Mir-Hossein Mousavi had won the Iran election

item.title: What would have happened if Mir-Hossein Mousavi had won the Iran election
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Anyways, Mousavi is still a conservative politician. Maybe some things would change, but Iran stays a nation ruled by Muslims no matter what.

Read full topic

item.title: What would have happened if Mir-Hossein Mousavi had won the Iran election
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

the iranian suprime leader would probably do something that makes the power of the president much lesser.

I dont get how Iran can claim to be a democracy when it has a suprime leader like this.
Whats more, the suprime leader derives his power from Allah, apparently…

Read full topic
